title: Pedagogical Approaches for Social Data Analysis Using Multiple Representations

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistical concepts and methods for analyzing social phenomena
context.additional_context: A process where current practitioners interpret social data through diverse representations (text, visualization, numerical) and refine concepts via whole-class discussions.

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts by interconverting social data between textual, visual, and numerical representations.
Learners can logically present connections between multiple representations during whole-class discussions.
Learners can analyze complex social phenomenon data using three or more representational methods and propose practical applications.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
